title: Why do you hate Yasuo?
body:
With his ban rate at the point is so high, I am curious why people have chosen him to be among the top bans.

Personally:
I find his most annoying trait to be His Q.
it charges up with only 2 times it is used.
I feel that making the ability into a 3 time use to charge would make him more fair to fight against.

replies.body:
Windwall.

A carry SHOULD NOT have a defensive ability that can defend the ENTIRE TEAM in such a big area for such a long time.

It should be a reactionary ability, something like Fioras riposte, not an entire wall that you can send anywhere.

if they made his wind wall actually destroy-able that may tone down the hate for him.

its is unique but health on the wall could fix that issue.

possibly scale the health with damage or something along that lines.

[1] Windwall can outright negate certain champions during fights if they rely on projectiles

[2] Yasuo tends to screw over team compositions (since he will often be chosen in place of a mage or tank)

[3] Personal experience has led me to distrust Yasuo players.  Whether they are on my team or the enemy team, I find they are rather likely to AFK, rage, feed and/or play alone if the game isn't favourable for them.

I ban Yasuo because I dislike playing with or against him.  I'm simply happier when he isn't in the game so I ensure he isn't.

Personally, i dont hate him. He's simply extremely, extremely unfun to play against - similar to Teemo and Riven. Even if he does no damage whatsoever he is still incredibly unsatisfying to play against because you have to devote a lot more resources to killing him than what is normal for champions like him. 

Low-elo translation: You have to work very hard to catch up and kill him, even if he is far behind. He is great at running away, thus you have to spend lots of time (and perhaps even summoner spells) to catch and kill him even if he's 0/7

Which leads me to my second reason for disliking him - whenever he is picked on my team i KNOW he's going to go 0/7. I dont ban him these days as there are higher priorities, but there was a point during his golden age where i would ban him just to make sure nobody would play him on my team.
You dont have to use up too much to kill him though, all it really takes is a well timed exhaust and a stun or two.

Way too snow ball-y. Can come from behind with nothing and be legendary by the end of the game, sort of like tryndamere.
Honestly, he is unfun to play against.
I really dislike his windwall. I could go into detail but other people already have

1. His scaling - e.g., he can get 100% crits with only 2 items, takes an expensive, nearly full build for anyone else to do that.
2. His windwall blocks so much, even if it is cast late.
3. His ult works off of so many different champion abilities.

What all of this amounts to is that even mediocre Yasuo players can wreck a team once they have a couple of items. Usually shutting someone down during laning is the way you deal with their scaling, but with Yasuo, that is less effective.

I'm sure higher tier players can deal with him more easily. They usually have better teamwork and better macro play. He is too oppressive in lower tiers, and it isn't totally based on player skill. It is more about his kit and his scaling.

His early game is ways too strong for how broken his late game is, also his jumps and his windwall are annoying to deal with as well.
But thanks to Riot senpai I can make sure I never have to see this emote spamming POS ever again. <3

"Look at me, I'm so cool, I'm dashing."

Fuck this
I have literally no problems fighting him unless I am playing a champion who he counters. I think people just refuse to learn how to play against him.

**YASUO IS NOT OP, HE IS FRUSTRATING!!!!**

that's irrelevant. I never said anything in my comment about him being OP. The author of this post asked "why do you ban Yasuo?" and i explained why I don't.
That actually makes no sense. What if you only enjoy champions he counters? Sure you can play against your counters too, but why bother when you can just ban him?

that's super irrelevant. 
If he counters me, I ban him. If he does not directly counter me, I ban akali.
Yes, but why do I have to listen to idiots constantly throwing out the "git gud" bullshit then? (not targeted at you)
Because most of the time, that's the solution. High elo players have no problems facing Yasuo players, they might find him annoying, but not OP. It's low elo that struggles to face Yasuo.
Which is about 75% of the player base. See the problem?
The problem is that 75% of the player base is fucking bronze. That's an issue.

His Q is able to be held for too long.
Windwall blocking entire things (Nami's wave for example) by hitting the last pixel in it (I don't have a problem with his wall other than that).
The stupid interaction where if you ult someone, it will push you 45 feet away just so you're not in tower range.
His shield.

Now, this stuff isn't a problem in of itself. But, when you combine it all, it's very annoying. And not even just combining it all. Combining it all on a champ that nukes you once he has 2 items. His power spike is too early for a "late game" champ in my opinion.

Basically, I just hate overloaded champions. And Yasuo is very overloaded.

Oh, and it seems like every Yasuo I get on my team feeds their ass off and it completely useless.

It doesn't change the fact his presence sucks the fun out of the game.

Everyone has champs that are boring or annoying to play against.

The thing that I don't like with Yasuo is his passive sheild. It always feels like he get it up again right in the last second to save him and make him kill me instead. I know I can play around it by poking it down and then engage so it isn't a nightmare. Though that he gets it back after he uses his ult is the tilting part that I think should be removed. Otherwise hes shield is very interactive to be up against.

I never ban Yasuo, not because I know he will get banned anyway but I have so many more champions that are so much worse to go up against than Yasuo. Cough Darius Cough
